txt.en: Crackskull
'I will, sir!'
'Where is Idella? Has she already gone ahead?'
'Hail, [placeholder]! You have done well to come this far into darkness, but the Silithar is no longer here!\n\n'Listen well, for I will tell you where now it lies!'

'You have done well to defeat Nornagol, [placeholder]! I have taken the Silithar and will deliver it to Calenglad. Return now to him with the tale of your adventure!\n\n'I will show you the way by hidden paths back to the surface.'
'Let us leave this place, [placeholder]. The Silithar must come safely to the surface, and I would speak with Calenglad before I return to my home.'
'You will have a share in the treasure we take from this tomb, of course.'
'Again you speak of the King. You bore me with these fantasies.'
'Very well. With these words, you forfeit any claim to the treasure as well as your lives.'
'Take them!'
'Enough of this! An extra share of the treasure to the man who brings me their heads!'
'Where is it? It's not here?'
'I was told it would be here! 'A stone of value beyond your dreams,' she said!'
'Yes, sir. I'll let them know.'
'Hear bugs go squish! Tasty, tasty!'
'On your feet! Idella wants you to move, and your dogs to start sniffing!'
'Sound of bugs! Sound of bugs!'
'Know bugs out there! Want bugs!'
'The stone you seek once bathed this room in golden light.'
'The flood-waters of Nenuial carried the stone into deep caverns.'
'I will show you the way, if you will follow.'
'You will find the stone you seek through this passage, but heed my words with care.'
'Do not wake Nornagol.'
'It may be slow to waking, but it is a creature of hate and will destroy you if it can.'
'Go now and hope that the memory of great Elendil smiles on your passing.'
'I told you not to wake Nornagol!'
'I will bring the Silithar to Calenglad, for I wish to speak with him again.'
'Halt, strangers.'
'You aren't part of my band. I would remember you.'
'We were here first, so the loot belongs to us. Show yourself out.'
'What? The King?'
'There hasn't been a king in Ann√∫minas for hundreds of years.'
'His treasures are now mine. Show them why, my friends!'
'You are made of sterner stuff than I expected, strangers!'
'There are suddenly some vacancies in my ranks.'
'They are yours if you want them. I have need of strength.'
Find the Silithar
'Aye.'
'What's that sound? Who goes there?'
'She has.'
'Idella is in the undrowned section already.'
'She is a good distance ahead.'
'An extra share of the loot to the man who slays these intruders!'
'What treasures lie now entombed with them, of no use to anyone?'
'Tell your men to use more caution down here!'
'We might have taken great treasures from that crypt, and now they've spoiled it!'
'Now is the chance to prove your worth!'
'At least now there will be fewer with which to divide the treasure!'
'Stop your snivelling! Think of the treasures that we'll find down here!'
'It's true! This was all underwater!'
'Who knows what riches were drowned in the deep reaches?'
'I heard that the Blue Lady was responsible for flooding this place, a long time ago.'
'There's treasure to be had further in, I'm sure of it!'
'Idella will split the treasure with us. I just wish there weren't so many of us!'
'Noser is going to have a leg of lamb when we're back to the surface. Aren't you, boy?'
'We're not the only ones poking into the unflooded section, I warrant.'
'Death to intruders!'
'No one knows what the kergrim want with treasure, but you find them in places like this.'
'Alarm! Alarm!'
'I hope Idella will be all right. She's tough, but she's fair, especially with treasure!'
'Wake! Crush foes! Wake!'
'Great sleeper awake!'
'Wait! Not Kergrim! Noooo!'
'Die!'
'Why won't you die?'
'No treasure is worth this!'
'Wretched creatures!'
'Aaaagh!'
'Why did I come to this miserable tomb?'
'Get away!'
'Get away from me, beasts!'
'Who goes there? I'll take you on!'
Instance: The Tomb of Elendil
'You don't think those beasts will come back, do you?'
'Idella won't let us down, right? True as they come, you said.'
'This place gives me the chills!'
'I heard something! Say the password!'
'What are you going to do with your share of the treasure?'
'What was that sound?'
'Do you believe those stories about the Blue Lady?'
'Have you out of there in no time, lads!'
'I'll want more of the loot for this, you understand?'
'Save some of the valuables for me!'
'Keep digging!'
'This place gives me the chills!'
'Oi! Can you hear me in there?'
'We're on our way! Hang on!'
You have journeyed into the Tomb of Elendil in search of the Silithar needed to reforge Narsil.
'Bring the rest of your dogs back here! Idella wants them sniffing out the treasure.'
'I'm saved! The treasure will all be mine!'
'I need to...catch my breath....'
'Oh no! Kergrim!'
'Quiet, now. We have company! Where have Idella's sneaks gone?'
'Idella is not going to be happy. That's all I'm going to say to you.'
'Excuses? I don't want to hear your excuses!'
'Don't make me reduce your shares of the treasure, because I will if you keep this up!'
'Bring my message to the Crypt-breaker! I will handle this!'

Idella Crypt-breaker is somewhere within the depths of the tomb of Elendil.\n\nCalenglad was right -- Idella Crypt-breaker's gang of tomb-robbers has taken advantage of the newly-lowered waters to plumb the depths of the tomb for treasure. She must be stopped.
Gwindeth has come to the Tomb of Elendil, and is waiting to speak with you in its deepest chamber.\n\nYou have dispatched Idella Crypt-breaker, but there is no sign of the Silithar.
'Did you hear that?'

The Silithar is somewhere in the caverns beneath the tomb of Elendil.\n\nYou did not find the Silithar in the final chamber of the tomb of Elendil -- it must have been carried somewhere by the retreating waters.
'I hope we don't see the Blue Lady down here. I've heard tales.'
Gwindeth is now in the cave beneath the tomb of Elendil.\n\nYou have recovered the Silithar, and Gwindeth waits to speak with you.
'These kings have been dead for hundreds of years. They don't need their loot anymore!'
